WYSIWYM.transformer
Class BrowsingGenerator

java.lang.Object
  WYSIWYM.transformer.GraphTransformer
      WYSIWYM.transformer.SemanticGraphTransformer
          WYSIWYM.transformer.FeedbackTextGenerator
              WYSIWYM.transformer.BrowsingGenerator
Direct Known Subclasses:
QueryResultGenerator, TextTypesGenerator
public class BrowsingGenerator
extends FeedbackTextGenerator

BrowsingGenerator generates the feedback text of an object in the database, adding both options for adding information and for viewing hidden information.

Version:
1.2 24-03-2008
Author:
Feikje Hielkema

Constructor Detail

BrowsingGenerator

public BrowsingGenerator(SemanticGraphTransformer sgt,
                         OntologyReader reader,
                         SesameReader s,
                         String userID,
                         boolean edit)
                  throws SesameException
Constructs a BrowsingGenerator for the given SemanticGraph. The generator will first extract all information about the graph root from the archive, then generate the feedback text.

Parameters:
sgt - SemanticGraphTransformer
reader - Ontology
s - Sesame
userID - User ID, store so we can check access rights to any downloadable resources
edit - if true, the text should contain editing options where the access rights permit
Throws:
SesameException - if there was an error retrieving information from the archive.

BrowsingGenerator

public BrowsingGenerator(SemanticGraphTransformer sgt,
                         OntologyReader reader,
                         boolean noAnchors,
                         SesameReader s,
                         String userID)
                  throws SesameException
Constructs a BrowsingGenerator for the given SemanticGraph. The generator will first extract all information about the graph root from the archive, then generate the feedback text.

Parameters:
sgt - SemanticGraphTransformer
reader - Ontology
noAnchors - If true, do not include any anchors, the text will not be browsable
s - Sesame
userID - User ID, store so we can check access rights to any downloadable resources
Throws:
SesameException - if there was an error retrieving information from the archive.

BrowsingGenerator

public BrowsingGenerator(SemanticGraph graph,
                         OntologyReader r,
                         SesameReader s)
Constructs a BrowsingGenerator for the given SemanticGraph. There is no initialisation, the generator assumes the given graph is complete.

Parameters:
graph - SemanticGraph
r - Ontology
s - Sesame

updateText

public void updateText()
                throws SurfaceRealisationException,
                       TextPlanningException
Overload: Updates the feedbacktext when the semantic graph has been changed

Overrides:
updateText in class FeedbackTextGenerator
Throws:
SurfaceRealisationException - if an error occurs during surface realisation
TextPlanningException - if an error occurs during text planning

getSurfaceText

public AnchorInfo[] getSurfaceText()
                            throws SurfaceRealisationException,
                                   TextPlanningException
Overload: returns serialisable version of feedback text where the last element is the key with which this generator is stored in the map.

Overrides:
getSurfaceText in class FeedbackTextGenerator
Returns:
AnchorInfo[] with feedback text
Throws:
SurfaceRealisationException - if an error occurs during surface realisation
TextPlanningException - if an error occurs during text planning

updateAnchor

public void updateAnchor(SGNode node)
Overload: updates the anchor for the given node. If no anchor is needed, it is removed. If this browsing session is editable, the parent method is used; if not, a simpler anchor is created, that only contains browsing options.

Overrides:
updateAnchor in class FeedbackTextGenerator
Parameters:
node - SGNode
See Also:
FeedbackTextGenerator.updateAnchor(SGNode)
